column1: On [[7 July]] [[1946]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to G.E. Selby'''.<ref name=CG>{{CG

column1: *'''Subject:''' Academic matters and a recent holiday with [[Edith Tolkien

*'''Publication:''' Extracts from the letter appeared in ''[[Sotheby's Nineteenth Century and Modern First Editions, Presentation Copies, Autograph Letters and Literary Manuscripts 28-29 July 1977]]'',<ref name=TB>{{webcite
column4: articlename=Nineteenth Century and Modern First Editions.1977
column7: accessed=28 January 2013}}</ref>, in ''[[Soteby's Catalogue of Printed Books, Manuscripts and Music 27 May and 10 June 1986]]'',<ref>{{webcite
column13: accessed=28 January 2013}}</ref> and in ''[[Maggs Bros. Autograph Letters and Historical Documents
column14: Maggs Bros. Autograph Letters & Historical Documents]]'' (Catalogue 1086, printed in 1988). A summary of the letter was provided by [[Christina Scull]] and [[Wayne G. Hammond]] in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column15: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''.<ref name=CG/>
